result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamilah N Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence. If revoked: Huber release privileges for childcare Only.

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.
*Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by December 15, 2016.  Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*No contact with Travis Academy or Tekiara B.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*Successfully complete "Anger Management"
*Follow probation rules of the agent.
*No new law violations rising to level of probable cause.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment, including random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kamilah N Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year: If revoked: Huber release privileges for childcare ONLY:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
  
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete "Anger Management".
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Follow probation rules of the agent.
     *   No new law violations rising to level of probable cause.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Travis Academy or Tekiara B.
     *   Court ordered DNA sample after today's proceedings.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by December 15, 2016.
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of  
          a civil judgment.
  .
-20 day appeal given,
   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

 Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered stayed warrant from August 25, 2015 lifted. For reasons stated on the record,

-CASE PASSED
-CASE RECALLED AT 1:59 P.M.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved Branch, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for calendar call.  Defense needs additional discovery and time to review.  Defendant has child care conflict this afternoon.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court via telephone.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: KAR. Case calendared for status conference.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled appearance.  Calendar call scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of hearing sent to defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Status conference on September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT IS DOWN on August 25, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37 on September 8, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference / possible DPA, additional discovery needed in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Possible DPA but defense counsel just was appointed also need additional discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/6/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kamilah N Martin
Current: 2536 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-05-2015)
Prior: 2536 North 14th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.R., J.J. and Travis Academy unless the school request her appearance or they approve of her having contact

Defendant Kamilah N Martin in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/5/15 @ 1:30 pm
